name: Kellin Vost
notable_contributions: Conducted experiments on synthetic beings - studied artificial creation and gathering behaviors
biographical_notes: Studies focus on how synthetic beings can be created and how they exhibit gathering/collecting behaviors

name: Tessaly Vorn
notable_contributions: Developed theory of how healing patterns operate across different material bases - signal vs substrate problem
biographical_notes: Addresses fundamental question of what persists when substrate changes

name: Venn Orenthal
notable_contributions: Colleague of Vornis Keth working on attractor dynamics and spatial theory
biographical_notes: Minor figure in spatial philosophy who worked alongside Keth

name: Wender Koss
notable_contributions: Developed pattern inheritance theory - how forms persist across generations
biographical_notes: Studies how patterns and forms survive transmission between generations

name: Cass
notable_contributions: Daughter of the Densmonger - significance unclear
biographical_notes: Appears in early Dens narrative; relationship to main figures unclear

name: Doyl
notable_contributions: Reputed chief of police - maintains order in Capital region
biographical_notes: Political figure; Tucker refers to 'real chief behind the chief'

name: Gull
notable_contributions: Storyteller on expedition; married a witch for 10 years; has genuine magical abilities; survives massacre
biographical_notes: Rare expedition survivor - magical abilities may explain survival

name: Harknet
notable_contributions: Explorer of territories beyond Mirado - frontier figure
biographical_notes: Represents exploration beyond established W1 territories

name: Nehlhen
notable_contributions: Council member - involved in Capital governance
biographical_notes: Political figure in Capital government structure

name: The Dodger
notable_contributions: Bald woman with dodger profession - nature of work unclear
biographical_notes: Travels with scholar Ulhido; 'dodger' may indicate evasion specialty

name: The Mapmaker
active_period: Travels with pickbox cart and five women roped to it - connected to Yeller mythology
source_documents: Non-Guild mapmaker with unusual traveling arrangement; cart has seventy sides

name: Tud
notable_contributions: Figure known by multiple derogatory nicknames - role unclear

name: Ulhido
notable_contributions: Scholar who travels with the dodger - field of study unclear
biographical_notes: Itinerant scholar; travels rather than staying at Capital institutions

name: Tucker
notable_contributions: Capital citizen and gobbly sprant hunter; knows about 'real chief behind the chief'
biographical_notes: Source of local political knowledge; gobbly sprant hunting indicates rural-adjacent life
